definitions.definition: with a lot of control and rules that must be obeyed

examples.text: She was brought up very strictly.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that something happens or must happen in all circumstances

examples.text: My letter is, of course, strictly private and confidential.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that something only applies to one particular person, thing or situation

examples.text: We'll look at the problem from a strictly legal point of view.
I know we're friends, but this is strictly business.

definitions.definition: if you are using words or rules in their exact or correct sense

examples.text: Strictly speaking, the book is not a novel, but a short story.
Using the word in that context is not, strictly speaking, correct.
